To comprehend the meaning of a Latin sentence, and to express that meaning in idiomatic English, are two distinct and · equally valuable arts. They should be made as distinct as possible. The pupil should learn to grasp the meaning of a Latin sentence in the orzginal, following tlte order os tlte Latin words He should also learn to express that meaning in idio- matie English. A literal translation should never be allowed, unless it happen to be also idiomatic.
